note.p: Birth: Faringdon, Berkshire, England (20 or 30 September 1842)
Death: His home in Birmingham, Warwickshire (13 March 1920)
Education: Culham Training College. Hon LLD (St Andrews)

Career: Schoolmaster, Episcopal Church school, Galashiels (for 11 years); studied geology; Assistant, Madras College, St Andrews (1875); Professor of Geology and Mineralogy, Mason Science College, Birmingham (1881)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1921 vol 92 pp xxxi-xl, plate, signed by J J H T and W W W
References: Beryl M Hamilton, '"A Geological Blunder", 1893: A Scientific Storm in a Journalistic Teacup' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 63-77
Notes: DSB gives birth date as 20 September 1842
